content.title: Jobs and Workplaces: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Selecciona la respuesta correcta para cada pregunta.

questions.question: Where does a teacher work?
questions.explanation: Los maestros trabajan en escuelas, ya que es el lugar donde enseñan a los estudiantes.

questions.question: Do doctors work in a bank?
questions.explanation: Los doctores trabajan en hospitales, no en bancos. Por lo tanto, la respuesta correcta es 'No, they don't'.

questions.question: Does a chef work in a school?
questions.explanation: Un chef trabaja en un restaurante o cocina, no en una escuela. Por eso, la respuesta correcta es 'No, he doesn't'.

questions.question: Where do nurses usually work?
questions.explanation: Las enfermeras generalmente trabajan en hospitales, donde cuidan a los pacientes.

questions.question: Does a waiter work in an office?
questions.explanation: Un camarero trabaja en un restaurante, no en una oficina. Por eso, la respuesta correcta es 'No, he doesn't'.

questions.sentence: ___ you work as a doctor or a nurse?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formar preguntas en presente simple para sujetos 'you', 'I', 'we', y 'they'.

questions.sentence: Where ___ your sister work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formar preguntas en presente simple para sujetos 'he', 'she', 'it'.

questions.sentence: ___ a teacher work in a hospital?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' porque 'a teacher' es singular y se refiere a 'he' o 'she'.

questions.sentence: What time ___ the bank open?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos singulares.

questions.sentence: ___ engineers work with computers?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' porque 'engineers' es plural y se refiere a 'they'.

questions.sentence: ___ your boss have a meeting every Monday?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' porque 'your boss' se refiere a 'he' o 'she'.

questions.sentence: Where ___ the chefs prepare the food?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos plurales como 'chefs'.

questions.sentence: Why ___ you want to become a firefighter?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple con el sujeto 'you'.

sentences.hint: Usa 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple.
Usa 'Does' para preguntas en tercera persona singular.
Usa 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple con 'they'.
Recuerda usar 'Does' para 'she' en preguntas.
Usa 'Do' para preguntar sobre más de una persona.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are at a coffee shop and meet someone new. They ask about your job.
questions.question: What do you say?
options: A) I am working in a school as a teacher.
B) I works in a school as a teacher.
C) I work in a school as a teacher.
D) I working in a school as a teacher.
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'I work in a school as a teacher' porque usa la forma correcta del presente simple para 'I'.

questions.scenario: Your friend is asking about your brother's job.
questions.question: What question do you ask?
options: A) Do your brother work at the office?
B) Does your brother works at the office?
C) Does your brother work at the office?
D) Do your brother works at the office?
questions.explanation: La pregunta correcta es 'Does your brother work at the office?' porque 'does' se usa con 'he/she/it' y el verbo base.

questions.scenario: You are discussing your weekend plans with a colleague.
questions.question: What do you say?
options: A) I will go to the cinema.
B) I going to the cinema.
C) I go to the cinema.
D) I goes to the cinema.
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'I will go to the cinema' porque estamos hablando de intenciones futuras.

questions.scenario: Your friend asks if you like your new job.
questions.question: What do you say?
options: A) Yes, I like it very much.
B) Yes, I likes it very much.
C) Yes, I liked it very much.
D) Yes, I liking it very much.
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'Yes, I like it very much' porque usamos 'like' con 'I' en presente simple.

questions.scenario: Someone asks about your sister's workplace.
questions.question: How do you respond?
options: A) She work in a hospital.
B) She works in a hospital.
C) She working in a hospital.
D) She is work in a hospital.
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'She works in a hospital' porque usamos 'works' con 'she' en presente simple.

content.title: Word Search: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: A person who treats sick people.
A person who helps doctors and cares for patients.
A person who helps students learn.
A person who designs and builds machines or buildings.
A person who keeps law and order.
A place where people work at desks.
A place where sick people are treated.
A place where students go to learn.
A person who designs buildings.
A person who practices law and gives legal advice.

content.title: Crossword: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: Who works in a school?
Who works to maintain public safety?
Where do people work at desks?
Who works in fields and grows crops?
Who helps doctors in a hospital?
Who cooks in a restaurant?
Where do people go to save and borrow money?

content.title: A Day at Work
content.textPassage: Maria works in a busy office. She is a secretary. Every day, she answers phones, writes emails, and helps her boss organize meetings. Her office is on the third floor of a big building in the city center. Maria likes her job because she meets many people and learns new things. She starts work at 9 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. Sometimes, she has lunch with her colleagues in a small café nearby. On Fridays, they finish work early and go to the park to relax. Maria always says that working in the office keeps her busy, but she enjoys it very much.

questions.question: What is Maria's job?
questions.explanation: La lectura menciona que Maria trabaja como secretaria en una oficina ocupada.

questions.question: Where is Maria's office located?
options: In a big building in the city center
questions.answer: In a big building in the city center
questions.explanation: El texto dice que la oficina de Maria está en un edificio grande en el centro de la ciudad.

questions.question: Maria starts work at 8 a.m.
questions.explanation: Maria comienza a trabajar a las 9 a.m., no a las 8 a.m.

questions.question: What does Maria do during her working day?
questions.explanation: Durante el día laboral, Maria contesta teléfonos y escribe correos electrónicos.

questions.question: Why does Maria like her job?
options: Because she earns a lot of money
Because she works with her family
questions.explanation: Maria disfruta de su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y aprende cosas nuevas.

questions.question: On Fridays, Maria finishes work early and goes to the park.
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que los viernes, Maria termina el trabajo temprano y va al parque.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Estrés de Palabras
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación y el estrés de palabras en las siguientes oraciones. Escucha el ejemplo de pronunciación y presta atención a las sílabas acentuadas. Lee cada oración en voz alta y concéntrate en el estrés correcto de las palabras clave.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The doctor works in a busy hospital.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El médico trabaja en un hospital concurrido.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de acentuar correctamente la primera sílaba de 'doctor' y 'busy'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No acentuar la primera sílaba de 'doctor'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: My sister is a talented artist.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Mi hermana es una artista talentosa.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfócate en la primera sílaba de 'sister' y la segunda de 'talented'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Confundir el estrés en 'talented'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The engineer designs new buildings.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El ingeniero diseña nuevos edificios.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Recuerda que 'engineer' tiene el estrés en la última sílaba.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Olvidar el estrés final en 'engineer'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She is a nurse at a local clinic.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella es enfermera en una clínica local.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Acentúa la primera sílaba de 'local' y 'clinic'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Pronunciar 'local' con el estrés incorrecto.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The chef prepares delicious meals.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El chef prepara comidas deliciosas.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfócate en el estrés de la segunda sílaba de 'delicious'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No enfatizar correctamente 'delicious'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: He is an accountant in a small firm.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Él es contador en una pequeña empresa.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Recuerda que 'accountant' tiene el estrés en la segunda sílaba.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Decir 'accountant' sin acentuar la sílaba correcta.

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question.

questions.question: Does Maria work in a hospital?
questions.explanation: En inglés, para responder afirmativamente a una pregunta en presente simple que comienza con 'Does', se usa 'Yes, she does.' para confirmar.

questions.question: Do the teachers finish work at 3 PM?
questions.explanation: Para preguntas en presente simple que comienzan con 'Do', la respuesta afirmativa correcta es 'Yes, they do.'

questions.question: Does your brother have a job in the bank?
questions.explanation: La forma correcta de responder afirmativamente a 'Does your brother have...' es 'Yes, he does.' porque 'does' es el auxiliar usado con 'he'.

questions.question: Do engineers work in an office?
questions.explanation: Para preguntas en presente simple que comienzan con 'Do', la respuesta afirmativa correcta es 'Yes, they do.'

questions.sentence: ________ your sister work as a teacher at the local school?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en tercera persona singular.

questions.sentence: Where ________ you usually have lunch during your work break?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en primera y segunda persona, y plural.

questions.sentence: ________ your parents own a business in town?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en plural.

questions.sentence: How ________ your brother travel to his job every day?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en tercera persona singular.

questions.sentence: What ________ you do when you finish work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en primera y segunda persona, y plural.

questions.sentence: Where ________ your friend work as a nurse?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en tercera persona singular.

questions.sentence: What time ________ they start their work at the factory?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en plural.

questions.sentence: Why ________ he enjoy working at the restaurant?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en tercera persona singular.

sentences.hint: Pregunta sobre el lugar de trabajo de una persona. Usa 'Where' al inicio.
Pregunta si alguien trabaja en un lugar específico. Comienza con 'Do'.
Pregunta sobre el lugar de trabajo usando 'Does'.
Usa 'Where' para preguntar sobre el lugar de trabajo.
Pregunta sobre el lugar de trabajo usando 'Do' al inicio.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are asking a friend about their brother's job.
questions.question: What does your brother do?
questions.explanation: La opción A utiliza correctamente el presente simple para describir la ocupación de alguien: 'He is a doctor'.

questions.scenario: A friend mentions they work at a café and you want to know more.
questions.question: Do you like working there?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'Yes, I do.', que es la forma correcta de responder afirmativamente a una pregunta con 'do'.

questions.scenario: You are at a job interview and they ask about your skills.
questions.question: What skills do you have?
options: A: I am good at computer.
B: I have good computer skills.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque usa correctamente el adjetivo 'good' para describir 'computer skills'.

questions.scenario: You want to know if your colleague is busy at work.
questions.question: Are you busy today?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'No, I am not.', que es la forma correcta de negar una pregunta con 'are you'.

questions.scenario: You meet someone new and want to ask about their job.
questions.question: What do you do?
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque se necesita el artículo 'a' antes de la profesión: 'I am a teacher'.

questions.scenario: You are curious about where your friend works.
questions.question: Where do you work?
options: A: I work in a hospital.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque sigue la estructura correcta de sujeto + verbo + lugar: 'I work in a hospital'.

content.title: Word Search: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: A person who helps sick people.
A person who helps doctors.
Works in a school.
A place where people work at desks.
A place where teachers work.
Works in the fields.
Designs and builds things.
A place where money is kept.
A place where things are sold.
Serves food in a restaurant.

content.title: Crossword: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: Who teaches students in a school?
Where do people work at desks?
Who helps doctors in a hospital?
Who cooks food in a restaurant?
Where do people keep their money?
Use this word to ask questions with 'he', 'she', or 'it'.

content.title: Understanding Work and Jobs
content.textPassage: Anna works in a small bakery in her town. She loves her job because she enjoys making bread and cakes. Every morning, she wakes up at 5 a.m. to start baking fresh products for the day. Does Anna work alone? No, she has a team of three people who help her. They prepare the dough and decorate cakes together. The bakery opens at 7 a.m. and many customers come to buy breakfast. Do they sell only bread? No, they also sell coffee and sandwiches. Anna's favorite part of her job is talking to the customers. She likes to ask them about their day and sometimes she gives them small samples to try. Anna works from Monday to Saturday, and she rests on Sundays. Does she have any plans for the future? Yes, she wants to open her own bakery one day.

questions.question: What is the main idea of the passage?
options: Anna works in a bakery and enjoys her job.
Anna works alone in the bakery.
questions.answer: Anna works in a bakery and enjoys her job.
questions.explanation: La idea principal del texto es sobre el trabajo de Anna en una panadería y cuánto disfruta de su trabajo.

questions.question: What time does the bakery open?
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que la panadería abre a las 7 a.m.

questions.question: Does Anna work alone?
questions.explanation: Anna no trabaja sola; tiene un equipo de tres personas que la ayudan.

questions.question: What is Anna's favorite part of her job?
questions.explanation: A Anna le gusta hablar con los clientes, y es su parte favorita del trabajo.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a product sold in the bakery?
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que venden pan, café y sándwiches, pero no menciona pasta.

questions.question: What are Anna's future plans?
questions.explanation: Anna planea abrir su propia panadería en el futuro, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: How many people work with Anna?
questions.explanation: Anna trabaja con un equipo de tres personas, como se indica en el texto.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Estrés en las Preguntas
content.instructions: En este ejercicio, practica la pronunciación de preguntas en inglés enfocándote en el estrés correcto de las palabras. Escucha el modelo de audio y repite cada oración. Presta atención al estrés en las palabras clave y asegúrate de practicar varias veces.

targetSentences.englishSentence: Does the manager work here?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Trabaja aquí el gerente?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca el estrés en 'manager' y 'here'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evitar poner estrés en 'does'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: Do they have a meeting today?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Tienen una reunión hoy?
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: du ðeɪ hæv ə ˈmitɪŋ təˈdeɪ?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pon el estrés en 'meeting' y 'today'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No poner estrés en 'do'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: Does she enjoy her job?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Disfruta ella de su trabajo?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca el estrés en 'enjoy' y 'job'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evitar acentuar 'does'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: Do you like your new office?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Te gusta tu nueva oficina?
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: du ju laɪk jʊr nu ˈɔfəs?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pon el estrés en 'like' y 'office'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No poner estrés en 'do'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: Does he need to call the client?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Necesita él llamar al cliente?
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: dʌz hi nid tə kɔl ðə ˈklaɪənt?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca el estrés en 'need' y 'client'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evitar acentuar 'does'.

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Elige la opción correcta para completar las preguntas en presente simple sobre trabajos comunes y lugares de trabajo.

questions.question: ___ your sister work as a nurse in the hospital?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formar preguntas en presente simple con la tercera persona del singular (he, she, it).

questions.question: ___ they have a meeting at the office every Monday?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formar preguntas en presente simple con la primera persona del singular y plural (I, we, you, they).

questions.question: ___ your brother like his job as a teacher?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple con 'he', 'she', y 'it'.

questions.question: ___ you usually finish work at 5 p.m.?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple con 'I', 'you', 'we', y 'they'.

questions.sentence: ___ your father work in a hospital or a school?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntar sobre el trabajo de una tercera persona singular (he, she, it).

questions.sentence: ___ you like to work as a teacher or a doctor?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formular preguntas sobre los gustos o deseos de la segunda persona (you).

questions.sentence: Where ___ your brother work?
questions.explanation: Para preguntar sobre el lugar de trabajo de una tercera persona singular, usamos 'does'.

questions.sentence: What ___ your friends do on weekends?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntar sobre las actividades de personas en plural (they).

questions.sentence: ___ your mother enjoy her job?
questions.explanation: Para preguntar si alguien disfruta su trabajo, usamos 'Does' con tercera persona singular.

questions.sentence: How often ___ you work late?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntar sobre la frecuencia de acciones en segunda persona.

questions.sentence: ___ they work in an office or at home?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntar sobre el lugar de trabajo de un grupo de personas (they).

questions.sentence: Why ___ the manager not like the new schedule?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'does' para preguntar sobre los sentimientos o preferencias de una tercera persona singular.

sentences.hint: Sujeto + verbo 'to be' + adjetivo + adverbio de grado

sentences.translation: Deberíamos ir a un restaurante nuevo.
sentences.hint: Pronombre + should + verbo + complemento

sentences.translation: Hay una botella grande en la mesa.
sentences.hint: There is + artículo + adjetivo + sustantivo + preposición + lugar
Pronombre + should + verbo + complemento
Sujeto + verbo 'to be' + adverbio de grado + adjetivo

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are at a job interview, and the interviewer asks you about your daily tasks.
questions.question: Interviewer: Can you tell me what you do every day at your current job?
options: I am working hard every day.
I work on reports and attend meetings.
I will work on reports tomorrow.
I worked on reports last week.
questions.explanation: La opción B es la correcta porque usa el presente simple para describir tareas diarias, que es lo que se espera en la situación dada.

questions.scenario: You are speaking with a colleague about a new project.
questions.question: Colleague: How do you usually approach new projects?
questions.explanation: La opción A es la correcta porque describe un hábito o acción regular utilizando el presente simple.

questions.scenario: You are at a networking event, introducing yourself to potential clients.
questions.question: You say: I am a marketing specialist. Do you work with any marketing firms?
options: Yes, I do work with one.
Yes, I am working with one.
Yes, I will work with one.
questions.explanation: La opción A es la correcta porque responde a la pregunta en presente simple, indicando un hecho actual.

questions.scenario: Your boss is asking about your availability for a meeting.
questions.question: Boss: Do you have time for a meeting this afternoon?
questions.explanation: La opción A es la correcta ya que es una respuesta directa y adecuada a una pregunta de sí/no en presente simple.

questions.scenario: A colleague asks about your opinion on a new workplace policy.
questions.question: Colleague: Do you think the new policy is effective?
questions.explanation: La opción A es la correcta porque es la forma adecuada de responder a una pregunta de opinión en presente simple.

content.title: Word Search: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: A person who teaches students.
A person who cares for sick people.
A person who designs and builds things.
A person who helps sick people feel better.
A place where people work at desks.
A place where animals and crops are raised.
A place where things are made.
A place where you buy things.
A place where students learn.
A place where sick people are treated.

content.title: Crossword: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: This person designs and builds machines or structures. (Across)
This person works in a school and helps students learn. (Down)
This person helps sick people. (Across)
This person helps to keep people safe and enforce the law. (Down)
This person works with animals or grows food on a farm. (Across)
A place where people work at desks with computers and phones. (Down)
This person works in a hospital and helps doctors. (Across)
This person cooks food in a restaurant. (Down)

content.title: A Day at the Office
content.textPassage: Anna works in a small office in the city. She is a receptionist. Every day, she answers the phone and helps visitors. Anna starts work at 9:00 AM and finishes at 5:00 PM. She does not work on weekends. Her office is on the second floor. There is a big window near her desk, and she can see the park. Anna likes her job because she meets many people. Sometimes, she talks to her colleagues during lunch. Anna's favorite colleague is Tom. He is very funny, and he works in the same office. They often have lunch together in a small café nearby.

questions.question: What is Anna's job?
questions.explanation: Anna trabaja como recepcionista en una oficina pequeña. El pasaje menciona que ella contesta el teléfono y ayuda a los visitantes, lo que es típico del trabajo de una recepcionista.

questions.question: Where is Anna's office located?
questions.explanation: La oficina de Anna está en la ciudad, como se menciona en la primera línea del pasaje.

questions.question: Does Anna work on weekends?
questions.explanation: El texto claramente indica que Anna no trabaja los fines de semana.

questions.question: Who is Anna's favorite colleague?
questions.explanation: Tom es el colega favorito de Anna, como se menciona que es muy divertido y trabajan en la misma oficina.

questions.question: What does Anna do during lunch?
questions.explanation: Durante el almuerzo, Anna a veces habla con sus colegas, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: Does Anna like her job?
questions.explanation: Anna le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, lo cual se menciona directamente en el texto.

content.title: Práctica de pronunciación: Énfasis en el trabajo
content.instructions: Escucha y repite las siguientes oraciones en inglés, enfocándote en el uso correcto del presente simple en preguntas y el vocabulario relacionado con trabajos y lugares de trabajo.

targetSentences.english: Does the teacher work at this school?
targetSentences.phonetic: /dʌz ðə ˈtiːʧər wɜrk æt ðɪs skuːl/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar 'does' al inicio de la pregunta para indicar que es una pregunta en presente simple.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfoca en 'does' y la pronunciación clara de 'teacher'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evitar omitir 'does' al inicio de la pregunta.

targetSentences.english: Do they work in the hospital?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza 'do' al inicio para clarificar que es una pregunta.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfoca en 'do' y la correcta pronunciación de 'hospital'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Asegúrate de no confundir la pronunciación de 'do' y 'they'.

targetSentences.english: Does your brother like his job as a chef?
targetSentences.spanish: ¿A tu hermano le gusta su trabajo como chef?
targetSentences.phonetic: /dʌz jɔr ˈbrʌðər laɪk hɪz ʤɒb æz ə ʃɛf/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Presta atención a la pronunciación de 'chef' y enfatiza 'does' al inicio.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfoca en 'does' y la pronunciación de 'brother'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evitar decir 'chef' como /ʃeɪf/.

targetSentences.english: Does she work in a big office?
targetSentences.phonetic: /dʌz ʃi wɜrk ɪn ə bɪg ˈɔfɪs/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar 'does' y pronunciar claramente 'office'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfoca en 'does' y la pronunciación de 'office'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No omitir el sonido /s/ al final de 'does'.

targetSentences.english: Do you enjoy your work as a nurse?
targetSentences.phonetic: /duː juː ɪnˈʤɔɪ jɔr wɜrk æz ə nɜrs/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza 'do' y presta atención a la pronunciación de 'nurse'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfoca en 'do' y la pronunciación de 'enjoy'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evitar confundir 'enjoy' con 'enjo'.

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question.

questions.question: Where does a doctor work?
questions.explanation: Los médicos trabajan en hospitales, donde tratan a los pacientes.

questions.question: Do teachers work with children?
questions.explanation: Los maestros trabajan con niños en escuelas, impartiendo clases y ayudándoles a aprender.

questions.question: Does a chef cook food?
questions.explanation: Un chef cocina comida en restaurantes u otros establecimientos gastronómicos.

questions.question: Where do cashiers usually work?
questions.explanation: Los cajeros suelen trabajar en supermercados, donde ayudan a los clientes a pagar por sus compras.

questions.question: Does an engineer design buildings?
questions.explanation: Un ingeniero puede diseñar edificios, aunque más comúnmente lo hace un arquitecto. Sin embargo, los ingenieros a menudo están involucrados en el diseño estructural.

questions.question: Do nurses assist doctors?
questions.explanation: Las enfermeras asisten a los médicos en el cuidado de los pacientes en hospitales y clínicas.

questions.sentence: ________ (Does/Do) a teacher work in a school?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formar preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en tercera persona singular (he, she, it). Aquí, 'a teacher' se refiere a 'he' o 'she'.

questions.sentence: ________ (Do/Does) doctors help sick people?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formar preguntas en presente simple con sujetos en primera y segunda persona del plural o singular (I, you, we, they). Aquí, 'doctors' es plural (they).

questions.sentence: Where ________ (do/does) a nurse work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'does' para preguntas con sujetos en tercera persona singular. 'A nurse' es 'he' o 'she'.

questions.sentence: ________ (Does/Do) engineers design buildings?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas con sujetos en plural. 'Engineers' es plural (they).

questions.sentence: What ________ (do/does) a firefighter do?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'does' para preguntas con sujetos en tercera persona singular. 'A firefighter' es 'he' o 'she'.

questions.sentence: ________ (Do/Does) chefs work in a restaurant?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas con sujetos en plural. 'Chefs' es plural (they).

questions.sentence: Where ________ (does/do) an artist work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'does' para preguntas con sujetos en tercera persona singular. 'An artist' es 'he' o 'she'.

questions.sentence: ________ (Do/Does) secretaries use computers?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas con sujetos en plural. 'Secretaries' es plural (they).

sentences.hint: Pregunta sobre el lugar de trabajo usando 'do'.
Pregunta si trabaja en una profesión usando 'does'.
Pregunta sobre el lugar de trabajo usando 'do'.
Pregunta sobre la ocupación usando 'does'.
Pregunta sobre el lugar de trabajo usando 'do'.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: Your friend asks you about your job.
questions.question: What do you do?
options: C: I will be a teacher.
D: I have been a teacher.
questions.explanation: La pregunta está en presente simple, por lo que la respuesta debe coincidir con el tiempo presente para describir tu trabajo actual.

questions.scenario: You are at a job interview. The interviewer asks:
questions.question: Do you work well in a team?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta a una pregunta en presente simple con 'do' es 'Yes, I do'. Las otras opciones no concuerdan.

questions.scenario: You meet someone new at a party who asks about your job.
questions.question: Where do you work?
options: A: I work in a bank.
B: I am working in a bank.
C: I worked in a bank.
D: I have worked in a bank.
questions.explanation: La pregunta usa el presente simple, así que la respuesta debe describir el lugar de trabajo actual usando el presente simple.

questions.scenario: Your colleague asks if you enjoy your job.
questions.question: Do you like your job?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta a una pregunta en presente simple con 'do' es 'Yes, I do'. Las otras opciones no son correctas en este contexto.

questions.scenario: Your boss asks if you can finish a report today.
questions.question: Do you have time to finish the report today?
questions.explanation: La pregunta está en presente simple utilizando 'do', por lo que la respuesta debe ser 'Yes, I do' para indicar que tienes tiempo.

questions.scenario: Your friend is curious about your work schedule.
questions.question: Do you work on weekends?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta a una pregunta en presente simple con 'do' es 'No, I don't'. Las otras opciones no concuerdan con la estructura de la pregunta.

content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

items.clue: Who designs buildings or machines?

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.text_passage: Maria works at the local library. She loves her job because she likes helping people find books. Every day, she opens the library at 9 a.m. and closes it at 6 p.m. Does Maria work on weekends? Yes, she does. On Saturdays, she helps organize events for children. Her favorite event is the storytelling hour. Do many people visit the library? Yes, they do. Students come to study, and families visit to borrow books. Where does Maria work? She works in the library's main hall most of the time, but sometimes she helps in the children's section. Does Maria enjoy her job? Yes, she enjoys it very much because she meets new people every day and discovers interesting books.

questions.question: What is the main idea of the passage?
options: Maria's daily routine at the library.
questions.answer: Maria's daily routine at the library.
questions.explanation: La idea principal del pasaje es sobre la rutina diaria de Maria en la biblioteca y cómo disfruta su trabajo.

questions.question: Does Maria work on weekends?
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que Maria trabaja los fines de semana, especialmente los sábados en eventos para niños.

questions.question: Where does Maria mostly work in the library?
questions.explanation: Maria trabaja principalmente en el salón principal de la biblioteca, aunque a veces ayuda en la sección infantil.

questions.question: What is Maria's favorite event at the library?
questions.explanation: El evento favorito de Maria es la hora de contar cuentos, según el pasaje.

questions.question: Do many people visit the library?
questions.explanation: El texto indica que muchas personas visitan la biblioteca, incluidos estudiantes y familias.

questions.question: Does Maria enjoy her job?
options: Yes, she enjoys it very much.
questions.answer: Yes, she enjoys it very much.
questions.explanation: Maria disfruta mucho su trabajo porque conoce gente nueva y descubre libros interesantes.

content.title: Práctica de pronunciación en inglés: Estrés de palabras
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación de las siguientes frases enfocándote en el estrés de las palabras resaltadas. Escucha el audio modelo para cada oración y repite después de escuchar. Presta atención a las sílabas acentuadas. Usa las transcripciones fonéticas para guiarte.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The doctor works in a busy hospital.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El doctor trabaja en un hospital ocupado.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza la primera sílaba de 'doctor' y 'busy'. La palabra 'hospital' tiene el estrés en la primera sílaba.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Palabras con dos o más sílabas a menudo tienen una sílaba acentuada. Escucha la diferencia.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No acentuar correctamente puede hacer que el oyente no entienda la palabra.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The teacher has a meeting at school.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El maestro tiene una reunión en la escuela.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Acentúa la primera sílaba en 'teacher' y 'meeting'. 'School' es una palabra monosilábica.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Escucha y repite las sílabas acentuadas para mejorar la claridad.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Ignorar el estrés en 'meeting' puede cambiar el significado percibido.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The manager is in the office.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El gerente está en la oficina.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: La palabra 'manager' tiene el estrés en la primera sílaba, mientras que 'office' lo tiene en la primera sílaba también.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Practica las palabras con tres sílabas para identificar la sílaba acentuada.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No confundir el estrés en 'manager', lo que puede llevar a una pronunciación incorrecta.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The engineer designs bridges.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El ingeniero diseña puentes.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: En 'engineer', el estrés está en la última sílaba. Acentúa la segunda sílaba de 'designs'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Identifica el patrón de estrés para palabras técnicas como 'engineer'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Ignorar el estrés final en 'engineer' puede llevar a confusiones.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The nurse gives medicine to patients.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: La enfermera da medicinas a los pacientes.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Acentúa la primera sílaba de 'medicine'. 'Patients' también tiene el estrés en la primera sílaba.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Escucha las diferencias en el estrés de palabras similares.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No acentuar adecuadamente 'medicine' puede llevar a una mala comprensión.

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Elige la respuesta correcta para cada pregunta sobre trabajos y lugares de trabajo.

questions.question: Where does a doctor work?
questions.explanation: Un médico trabaja en un hospital, donde atiende a los pacientes y realiza procedimientos médicos.

questions.question: Does a teacher work with students?
questions.explanation: Un maestro trabaja con estudiantes en un entorno educativo como una escuela o universidad.

questions.question: What does a chef do?
questions.explanation: Un chef cocina alimentos en un restaurante u otro establecimiento de comida.

questions.question: Does a police officer work in a bank?
questions.explanation: Un oficial de policía no trabaja en un banco; trabaja para mantener el orden y la seguridad pública.

questions.sentence: ______ (Do) you work in a bank or a supermarket?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la segunda persona del singular (you).

questions.sentence: Where ______ (does) she work as a teacher?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la tercera persona del singular (he, she, it).

questions.sentence: ______ (Do) they have to wear a uniform at the office?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la tercera persona del plural (they).

questions.sentence: What time ______ (does) the doctor start seeing patients?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la tercera persona del singular (he, she, it).

questions.sentence: ______ (Do) you and your colleagues take a lunch break?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la segunda persona del plural (you).

questions.sentence: How often ______ (does) your brother travel for work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la tercera persona del singular (he, she, it).

questions.sentence: ______ (Do) the chefs cook in this restaurant every day?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la tercera persona del plural (they).

questions.sentence: Where ______ (does) your sister work as a nurse?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formular preguntas en presente simple para la tercera persona del singular (he, she, it).

sentences.hint: Empieza con 'Do' para hacer una pregunta en presente simple.
Comienza con 'Does' para hacer una pregunta sobre él o ella.
Preguntas con 'do' para ellos o nosotros.
Usa 'Does' para preguntar sobre otra persona.
Empieza con 'Do' para preguntas sobre nosotros.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are at a job interview, and the interviewer asks about your previous work experience.
questions.question: Interviewer: 'What do you do at your current job?'
options: A: I am working as a teacher.
B: I work as a teacher.
C: I was working as a teacher.
D: I have worked as a teacher.
questions.explanation: La pregunta está en presente simple, por lo que la respuesta también debe estar en presente simple: 'I work as a teacher'.

questions.scenario: You are talking to a friend about your job responsibilities.
questions.question: Friend: 'Do you like your job?'
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'Yes, I do' porque sigue la estructura del presente simple para respuestas cortas.

questions.scenario: You are explaining your daily routine to a colleague.
questions.question: Colleague: 'What time do you start work?'
options: A: I start work at 9 o'clock.
B: I am starting work at 9 o'clock.
C: I have started work at 9 o'clock.
D: I started work at 9 o'clock.
questions.explanation: La pregunta está formulada en presente simple, por lo que la respuesta también debe estar en presente simple: 'I start work at 9 o'clock'.

questions.scenario: You are at a networking event and someone asks about your workplace.
questions.question: Person: 'Where do you work?'
options: A: I work in a bank.
B: I am working in a bank.
C: I have worked in a bank.
D: I worked in a bank.
questions.explanation: La pregunta está en presente simple, así que la respuesta debe ser en presente simple: 'I work in a bank'.

questions.scenario: A friend is curious about your job title.
questions.question: Friend: 'What do you do?'
options: B: I am being a doctor.
C: I have been a doctor.
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'I am a doctor' porque describe tu ocupación actual en presente simple.

This person operates vehicles like cars or buses.

content.title: El mundo del trabajo
content.textPassage:
Juan is a teacher. He works at a primary school in Madrid. Every day, he teaches math and science to young students. His day starts at 8:00 in the morning, and he usually finishes at 3:00 in the afternoon. Juan loves his job because he enjoys helping children learn new things. On weekends, he sometimes prepares lessons for the next week. Do his students like him? Yes, they do. They say he is friendly and patient. 

Maria is a nurse. She works at a hospital in Barcelona. Her job is very busy, and she works different shifts. Sometimes she works in the morning, and other times she works at night. Does Maria like her job? Yes, she does. She likes helping people feel better. In her free time, she likes to read and relax at home. 

Pedro is a chef. He works in a restaurant in Valencia. Every day, he cooks delicious meals for the customers. He starts work at 10:00 in the morning and finishes late at night. Does Pedro enjoy cooking? Yes, he does. He loves trying new recipes and making people happy with his food.

questions.question: What does Juan do?
questions.explanation: Juan es maestro en una escuela primaria, tal como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: Where does Maria work?
questions.explanation: Maria trabaja en un hospital en Barcelona, según el pasaje de lectura.

questions.question: Does Pedro work at night?
questions.explanation: Pedro trabaja hasta tarde en la noche, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: What do Maria and Pedro have in common?
options: They both work in a hospital.
questions.explanation: Tanto Maria como Pedro disfrutan de sus trabajos, lo cual se destaca en el texto.

questions.question: TRUE or FALSE: Juan sometimes prepares lessons on weekends.
questions.explanation: El texto indica que Juan a veces prepara lecciones durante los fines de semana.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned about Juan?
questions.explanation: No se menciona que Juan trabaje en un hospital. Él trabaja en una escuela.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Estrés de Oraciones
content.instructions: Escucha las oraciones en inglés y practica la pronunciación con atención al estrés de las oraciones. Repite cada oración varias veces, enfocándote en las palabras que llevan el estrés principal.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She works in a busy office.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella trabaja en una oficina ocupada.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca el estrés en 'busy' y 'office'. Pronuncia claramente las consonantes finales.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No omitir el sonido /s/ al final de 'office'

targetSentences.englishSentence: Does he like his new job?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Le gusta su nuevo trabajo?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: El estrés está en 'like' y 'job'. Asegúrate de que el sonido /dʒ/ en 'job' es claro.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No reducir demasiado la vocal /i/ en 'he'

targetSentences.englishSentence: The teacher helps the students.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El maestro ayuda a los estudiantes.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: El estrés está en 'teacher' y 'students'. Pronuncia el sonido /tʃ/ de 'teacher' claramente.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No confundir el sonido /tʃ/ con /ʃ/

targetSentences.englishSentence: Do you have to work on Saturday?
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: ¿Tienes que trabajar el sábado?
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: /duː ju hæv tə wɜːrk ɒn ˈsætərdeɪ/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca el estrés en 'work' y 'Saturday'. La /æ/ en 'Saturday' debe ser clara.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No omitir el sonido /k/ al final de 'work'

targetSentences.englishSentence: My brother is a doctor.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Mi hermano es médico.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: El estrés está en 'brother' y 'doctor'. La /ð/ en 'brother' debe ser suave.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No confundir el sonido /ð/ con /d/

targetSentences.englishSentence: She doesn't like working late.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: A ella no le gusta trabajar hasta tarde.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: El estrés está en 'like' y 'late'. Asegúrate de que el sonido /ŋ/ en 'working' es nasal.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No omitir el sonido /t/ al final de 'late'

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Selecciona la opción correcta. Todas las preguntas están en presente simple. Usa 'do' o 'does' según corresponda.

questions.question: Where ___ your brother work?
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'does' porque la pregunta es sobre 'your brother', que es tercera persona del singular.

questions.question: ___ they have to wear uniforms at the factory?
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'do' porque la pregunta es sobre 'they', que es tercera persona del plural.

questions.question: What time ___ the bank open?
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'does' porque la pregunta es sobre 'the bank', que es tercera persona del singular.

questions.question: How ___ you go to work every day?
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'do' porque la pregunta es sobre 'you', que es segunda persona del singular o plural.

questions.sentence: ________ you work in an office or a factory?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formular preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'you'.

questions.sentence: What time ________ the manager arrive at the store?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'does' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'he', 'she' o 'it'. Aquí, 'the manager' es singular.

questions.sentence: ________ your brother like his job as a teacher?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'he', 'she' o 'it'. En este caso, 'your brother' es 'he'.

questions.sentence: Where ________ the nurses work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'they'. Aquí, 'the nurses' es 'they'.

questions.sentence: ________ your parents have their own business?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'they'. 'Your parents' es plural y corresponde a 'they'.

questions.sentence: How often ________ she travel for work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'does' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'he', 'she' o 'it'. Aquí, el sujeto es 'she'.

questions.sentence: ________ the chef prepare meals every day?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'he', 'she' o 'it'. Aquí, 'the chef' es singular.

questions.sentence: Why ________ electricians often work with engineers?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'do' para preguntas en presente simple cuando el sujeto es 'they'. 'Electricians' es plural y corresponde a 'they'.

sentences.hint: Pregunta sobre la ubicación de trabajo de una profesión.
Pregunta sobre la actividad realizada por una profesión.
Pregunta sobre la ubicación de trabajo de una profesión.
Pregunta sobre la actividad realizada por una profesión.
Pregunta sobre la ubicación de trabajo de una profesión.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are talking to a friend about his job at a bakery.
questions.question: What question do you ask to know about his working hours?
options: A) Do you enjoy your job?
B) What time do you start working?
C) Do you work with a team?
D) Where is the bakery located?
questions.explanation: La opción 'What time do you start working?' es la pregunta correcta si deseas saber el horario de trabajo de tu amigo. Las otras opciones no se centran en el tiempo de trabajo.

questions.scenario: You're at a job interview for a position as a receptionist.
questions.question: The interviewer asks: 'Do you have experience in this field?' How do you respond politely if you don't have experience?
options: C) No, but I am very eager to learn.
questions.explanation: La respuesta 'No, but I am very eager to learn.' es la más educada y muestra disposición para aprender, lo cual es importante en una entrevista de trabajo.

questions.scenario: You are discussing your new job with a colleague during lunch.
questions.question: Which question would you ask to know more about their role?
options: A) What does your job involve?
questions.explanation: La pregunta 'What does your job involve?' es la adecuada para obtener más información sobre las funciones de su compañero en el trabajo.

questions.scenario: A friend is telling you about her job as a teacher.
questions.question: What is a natural follow-up question to ask?
options: B) Do you have a pet?
questions.explanation: La opción 'Do you teach mathematics?' es una continuación natural de la conversación sobre su trabajo como maestra, mientras que las otras opciones son irrelevantes.

questions.scenario: You're asking a colleague about their job responsibilities.
questions.question: How do you phrase your question?
options: A) What do you do every day?
B) Do you like your boss?
C) Where is the coffee shop?
D) Are you going home soon?
questions.explanation: La opción 'What do you do every day?' pregunta sobre las responsabilidades diarias en el trabajo, que es el tema relevante en este contexto.

questions.scenario: You are curious about the work environment at a friend's office.
questions.question: What question do you ask?
options: A) Do you enjoy your work environment?
B) Do you have a car?
C) Is your office far from home?
questions.explanation: La pregunta 'Do you enjoy your work environment?' es la adecuada para saber más sobre el entorno laboral de tu amigo, mientras que las otras opciones no están relacionadas con el entorno de trabajo.

content.title: Word Search: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: A person who helps you learn

Works with doctors to care for patients

content.title: Crossword: Work and Jobs
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: Who answers the phone and greets visitors in an office?
Who works in a school? (Hint: They help students learn)
Who helps sick people in a hospital?
Where do many people work with computers and papers?
Who works on a farm and grows crops?
Who assists doctors and takes care of patients?
Where do people go to keep their money safe?
Who cooks food in a restaurant?

content.title: Daily Routines at Work
content.textPassage: Maria works at a small bakery in her town. She loves her job because she enjoys baking and talking to customers. Every morning, Maria opens the bakery at 7 AM. Does she make bread first? No, she starts by making cakes and cookies. Many people come to the bakery for breakfast and enjoy fresh pastries. Does Maria work alone? No, she works with her friend, John. John makes coffee and serves drinks. They both clean the bakery before closing at 3 PM. Maria always asks her customers, 'Do you like the pastries?' Most people say they are delicious! In the afternoon, Maria sometimes goes to the market to buy fresh ingredients. Does she have weekends off? Yes, the bakery is closed on Saturdays and Sundays. On those days, Maria spends time with her family. She often asks, 'Do you want to go to the park?' They enjoy picnics and playing games together.

questions.question: What is the main idea of the passage?
options: Maria's daily routine at the bakery.
John's job at the coffee shop.
The types of bread Maria makes.
questions.answer: Maria's daily routine at the bakery.
questions.explanation: La idea principal se centra en las actividades diarias de Maria en la panadería.

questions.question: What does Maria make first in the morning?
questions.explanation: Maria empieza su día horneando pasteles y galletas, no pan.

questions.question: Who works with Maria at the bakery?
questions.explanation: John es el amigo de Maria que trabaja con ella en la panadería.

questions.question: Does Maria work on weekends?
questions.explanation: La panadería está cerrada los sábados y domingos, así que Maria no trabaja esos días.

questions.question: What does John do at the bakery?
options: He makes coffee and serves drinks.
questions.answer: He makes coffee and serves drinks.
questions.explanation: John se encarga de preparar café y servir bebidas en la panadería.

questions.question: Is the bakery open in the afternoon?
options: No, it only opens in the morning.
questions.explanation: La panadería cierra a las 3 PM, por lo que no está abierta por la tarde.

questions.question: True or False: Maria usually buys fresh ingredients in the morning.
questions.explanation: Maria compra ingredientes frescos por la tarde, no por la mañana.

questions.question: What does Maria often ask her family on weekends?
options: Do you want to go to the park?
Do you want to help at the bakery?
Do you want to go shopping?
questions.answer: Do you want to go to the park?
questions.explanation: Maria a menudo pregunta a su familia si quieren ir al parque los fines de semana.

content.title: Práctica de pronunciación para el trabajo
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación de las siguientes oraciones enfocándote en el uso correcto del presente simple con preguntas. Escucha atentamente la grabación y repite cada oración. Después, intenta decirlas en voz alta sin leer.

targetSentences.english: Does she work at the hospital?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza ligeramente el 'Does' al inicio de la pregunta para distinguirla como pregunta.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfócate en la entonación ascendente al final de la pregunta.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evita pronunciar 'does' como 'dos'; el sonido es /dʌz/.

targetSentences.english: Do you know the new manager?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de que 'new' suene como /nuː/ y no como /njuː/.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Mantén una entonación ascendente al final para marcar la pregunta.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No omitas el sonido /j/ en 'you'.

targetSentences.english: Does he have to wear a uniform?
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: /dʌz hi hæv tə wɛər ə ˈjuːnɪfɔːrm/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: La palabra 'uniform' comienza con el sonido /juː/, no /uː/.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Focalízate en la conexión entre 'have' y 'to'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evita decir 'haves' en lugar de 'have'.

targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Presta atención a la diferencia entre 'their' /ðeər/ y 'there' /ðeər/.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Asegúrate de que 'office' suene correctamente como /ˈɒfɪs/.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No confundir 'like' con 'likes'; aquí no lleva 's'.

targetSentences.english: Does your brother enjoy his job?
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de pronunciar 'enjoy' con el sonido /ɪnˈdʒɔɪ/.
targetSentences.focusPoints: La entonación debe subir al final de la pregunta.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evita omitir el sonido /dʒ/ en 'enjoy'.

content.title: Work and Jobs: Present Simple Questions
content.instructions: Selecciona la respuesta correcta para cada pregunta utilizando el presente simple con 'do/does'.

questions.question: Where does the teacher work?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'In a school' porque un profesor trabaja en una escuela. Las otras opciones son lugares de trabajo para diferentes profesiones.

questions.question: Do nurses work at night?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'Yes, they do' porque la pregunta está hecha en presente simple, y la forma correcta de responder es usando 'do'.

questions.question: Does a chef cook food?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'Yes, he does' porque 'does' es la forma correcta en presente simple para he/she/it cuando se responde afirmativamente.

questions.question: Where do bank tellers work?
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'In a bank' porque los cajeros de banco trabajan en un banco. Las otras opciones no son lugares adecuados para su trabajo.

questions.sentence: ___ you work in a hospital or an office?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para formar preguntas en present simple con 'you', 'we', 'they'.

questions.sentence: Where ___ your brother work?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para formar preguntas en present simple con 'he', 'she', 'it'.

questions.sentence: ___ your parents have jobs in the city?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas con 'your parents' (ellos).

questions.sentence: What time ___ the bank open?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' porque 'the bank' es singular (it).

questions.sentence: ___ your teacher give you homework every day?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas en present simple con 'your teacher' (él/ella).

questions.sentence: Where ___ you usually buy your groceries?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Do' para preguntas con 'you'.

questions.sentence: ___ it take long to get to your workplace?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' con 'it' para formar preguntas en present simple.

questions.sentence: What ___ your sister do for a living?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'Does' para preguntas con 'your sister' (ella).
